Write a program to print sum of square of n natural number

Input  : 3
Output : 14

# Input
n = int(input('Input : '))

# Finding sum of square
total = [x**2 for x in range(1,n+1)]

# Output
print('Output: ',sum(total))

import java.io.*;
import java.util.*;

class SumOfSquare {

    public static int squaresum(int n)
    {
        return (n * (n + 1) / 2) * (2 * n + 1) / 3;
    }

    public static void main(String[] args)
    {
        // Input character
        Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);
        System.out.print("Input: ");
        int n = sc.nextInt();

        // output ASCII value
        System.out.println(squaresum(n));
    }
}

#include <iostream>
using namespace std;

int main()
{
    int a, total = 0;
    cout << "Input : ";
    cin >> a;
    for (int i = 1; i <= a; i++)
    {
        total += (i * i);
    }
    cout << "Output : " << total << endl;
    return 0;
}

#include <stdio.h>

int main()
{
    int n;
    int result = 0;

    printf("n : ");
    scanf("%d", &n);

    for (int i = 1; i <= n; i++)
    {
        result += i * i;
    }

    printf("\nsum : %d\n", result);
    return 0;
}

var readline = require("readline");

var rl = readline.createInterface({
  input: process.stdin,
  output: process.stdout,
});

rl.question("Input  : ", function (N) {
  // Read N
  N = parseInt(N);
  N = (N * (N + 1) * (2 * N + 1)) / 6;
  console.log("Output :", N);
  rl.close();
});

// Check it here : https://onecompiler.com/javascript/3y5c8z56m

package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"log"
	"os"
)

func main() {
	var numberInput int

	fmt.Print("Enter the number : ")
	fmt.Scanln(&numberInput)

	squareOfNumberInput, err := sumOfSquares(numberInput)
	if err != nil {
		log.Fatal(err)
	}

	fmt.Fprintf(os.Stdout, "\nThe sum of the squares of %d is: %d\n", numberInput, squareOfNumberInput)
}

func sumOfSquares(number int) (int, error) {
	var result int
	for i := 1; i <= number; i++ {
		result += i * i
	}
	return result, nil
}

using System;
using System.Linq;

public class SumOfSquare
{
    public static void Main(string[] args)
    {
        Console.Write("Input  : ");
        int num;
        if (int.TryParse(Console.ReadLine(), out num))
        {
            double total =
                Enumerable
                    .Range(1, Math.Abs(num))
                    .Aggregate(0, (a, b) => a + (int) Math.Pow(b, 2));

            Console.WriteLine($"Output : {total}");
        }
        else
        {
            Console.WriteLine("Input Err");
        }
    }
}

// Write a program to print sum of square of n natural number

package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"log"
	"os"
)

func main() {
	var numberInput int

	fmt.Print("Enter the number : ")
	fmt.Scanln(&numberInput)

	squareOfNumberInput, err := sumOfSquares(numberInput)
	if err != nil {
		log.Fatal(err)
	}

	fmt.Fprintf(os.Stdout, "\nThe sum of the squares of %d is: %d\n", numberInput, squareOfNumberInput)
}

func sumOfSquares(number int) (int, error) {
	var result int
	for i := 1; i <= number; i++ {
		result += i * i
	}
	return result, nil
}


// Write a program to print sum of square of n natural number

var readline = require("readline"); // Process to read standard input

var rl = readline.createInterface({
  input: process.stdin,
  output: process.stdout,
});

rl.question("Input  : ", function (N) {
  // Read N
  N = parseInt(N); // Convert the input into integer
  N = (N * (N + 1) * (2 * N + 1)) / 6; // Appy the equation
  console.log("Output :", N); // Printing the result
  rl.close();
});


// Write a program to print sum of square
#include <iostream>
using namespace std;

int main()
{
    int a, total = 0;
    cout << "Input : ";
    cin >> a;
    for (int i = 1; i <= a; i++)
    {
        total += (i * i);
    }
    cout << "Output : " << total << endl;
    return 0;
}


// Write a program to print sum of square.
import java.util.*;

class SumOfSquare {

    public static int squaresum(int n) {
        return (n * (n + 1) / 2) * (2 * n + 1) / 3;
    }

    public static void main(String[] args) {
        try (// Input character
                Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in)) {
            System.out.print("Input: ");
            int n = sc.nextInt();

            // output ASCII value
            System.out.println(squaresum(n));
        }
    }
}


// Write a program to print sum of square of n natural number
using System;
using System.Linq;

public class SumOfSquare
{
    public static void Main(string[] args)
    {
        Console.Write("Input  : ");
        int num;
        if (int.TryParse(Console.ReadLine(), out num))
        {
            double total =
                Enumerable
                    .Range(1, Math.Abs(num))
                    .Aggregate(0, (a, b) => a + (int) Math.Pow(b, 2));

            Console.WriteLine($"Output : {total}");
        }
        else
        {
            Console.WriteLine("Input Err");
        }
    }
}


# Write a program to print sum of square
# Input
n = int(input('Input : '))

# Finding sum of square
total = [x**2 for x in range(1, n+1)]

# Output
print('Output: ', sum(total))


// Write a programme to find sum of squares of first n natural numbers.

#include <stdio.h>

int main()
{
    int n;
    int result = 0;

    printf("n : ");
    scanf("%d", &n);

    for (int i = 1; i <= n; i++)
    {
        result += i * i;
    }

    printf("\nsum : %d\n", result);
    return 0;
}
